elements.title: Using Tana's Supertags with Search (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Using Tana's Supertags with Search

Learn how to use Tana's supertags with live searches and create amazing workflows.

elements.title: Learn how to use Supertags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Learn how to use Supertags in Tana

Understand the basics of how to use Tana's supertags.

elements.title: Using Tana's Live Search Feature (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Using Tana's Live Search Feature

Learn how to use Tana's live searches.

elements.title: Get oriented in Tana's UI (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Get oriented in Tana's UI

Get started with Tana by exploring its main UI and navigation features.

elements.title: Everything is a Node in Tana (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Everything is a Node in Tana

Learn how to use Tana's nodes.

elements.title: Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Tana

Data About Nodes - Fields and Tags in Tana

Learn how to leverage Tana's fields and tags to record data about individual nodes.

elements.title: New Time Units for Higher Productivity (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Productivity

New Time Units for Higher Productivity

Our common measures of time never worked for me for time management. So I invented my own.

elements.title: The Input Channel Audit (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

The Input Channel Audit

A quick How To guide for shaping your information diet

elements.title: Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Attention Design

Develop Strong Criteria for Input Triage

'How in the world. You need less Twitter in your life.' I had, again, discarded my guard rails of attention design and failed at input triage.

elements.title: The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Seven Questions At The Heart Of Knowledge Ops

Personal Knowledge Management is too restrictive – you want to think about all seven of these questions instead.

elements.title: The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Knowledge Ops

The Grazing – Feeding Model of Information Gathering

On the Internet, information is limitless. The Grazing-Feeding Model of Information Gathering helps you know how you're engaging with that information.

elements.title: Sadly, Constraints Are Real (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Constraints

Sadly, Constraints Are Real

For the last 15 years I've ignored one fundamental truth: real constraints exist. Here's what I'm trying now.

elements.title: Adversarial Reading (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

Adversarial Reading

Bullshit is everywhere, and these algorithms of thought help you do more adversarial reading.

elements.title: How to improve a process (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

How to improve a process

With taking notes as an example, let's talk about how to improve any process.

elements.title: Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Note-taking

Don't Fiddle With Your Note-Taking System

You should stick to one note-taking system and fiddle with it as little as possible. That's a myth.

elements.title: Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Peer Review

Get Rid of Peer Review and Academic Journals

Why to get rid of peer review and academic journals as we know them – and possibly what to do instead.

elements.title: You Actually Need to Context Switch (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Atomic Essay: Productivity

You Actually Need to Context Switch

Common wisdom says that you need to avoid context switching. That's only half true – sometimes you need to context switch.

elements.title: How to Context Switch Like a Pro (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Productivity

How to Context Switch Like a Pro

Context switching is unavoidable – but you can make it less costly by combining a couple of simple strategies.

elements.title: A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

A Tale of Two Biases: How To Read The News

Counter two frequent biases while reading the news: Selection Bias and Description Bias.

elements.title: How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Interstitial Journaling

How to use Roam Research for Interstitial Journaling

Interstitial Journaling is a great technique for minimizing context switching costs and staying productive. Here's how I use it in Roam Reserch.

elements.title: Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Academic Workflow

Why You Should Pick Zotero As A Reference Manager

A guide to reference managers, what you should expect from them and why Zotero is the reference manager you should use - whether you're in academia or not.

elements.title: Behavior First, Theory Second (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Learning

Behavior First, Theory Second

Behavior and Theory are two heuristics that can help you in deciding between courses and teachers.

elements.title: True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

True Algorithms of Thought Have Arrived

Can you imagine being able to transfer 'mental software' between people? It's now possible, by using Algorithms of Thought in Roam Research.

elements.title: The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Programming Attention

The Power of Keystone Habits with Roam Research

How to use Roam Research as your keystone habit to regularly revisit writing that is important to you, using the ∆ feature in Roam.

elements.title: Zotero and Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Academic Workflow

Zotero and Roam Research

A guide for using Roam Research together with Zotero to get the most out of your citation metadata.

elements.title: A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Spaced Repetition

A short (preliminary) guide to Spaced Repetition in Roam Research

How to use Roam Research's new Delta feature to do Spaced Repetition and never forget anything again.

elements.title: My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Zettelkasten

My grandfather's research technique - Index, Proto-Zettelkasten, Paper

My grandfather's way of doing history research before the computer age. Using paper and a meticulous process, he built something close to a Zettelkasten.

elements.title: How to cure Highlight Dementia (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

How to cure Highlight Dementia

How to make sure that you never lose insights when reading and highlighting. Because Highlight Dementia is completely preventable.

elements.title: Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

Actor's Concepts and Inventing Discovery

How discovery became an actor's concept - and what you can use that for. Can you play chess without knowing that you are doing so?

elements.title: Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Reading

Getting Started with Algorithms of Thought

An introduction to Algorithms of Thought - how they differ from Mental Models and how to use them in Roam Research.

elements.title: Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Polymathy

Universal-X - Of Polymaths and other fantastic creatures

There are words you can't use to describe yourself without sounding like an utter ass. Imagine asking someone at a party who they are and they respond with 'Nice to meet you, I'm a brilliant photographer/physicist/writer' - instant, life-long friends you'll be, no?

elements.title: The Right to Disagree (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Algorithm of Thought

The Right to Disagree

Contrary to popular belief, you can't just disagree with someone because you feel like it. You have to __earn__ the right to disagree with someone's position.

elements.title: A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research (Cortex Futura)
elements.contents:
Article: Roam Research

A Gruvbox Theme for Roam Research

How to create a Gruvbox-style color theme for Roam Research using Roam's built-in CSS capabilities.

elements.title: R-loop-derived cytoplasmic RNA–DNA hybrids activate an immune response (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
R-loop-derived cytoplasmic RNA–DNA hybrids activate an immune response

RNA–DNA hybrids are immunogenic species that can aberrantly accumulate in the cytoplasm after R-loop processing, linking R-loop accumulation to cell death through the innate immune response.

  • Magdalena P. Crossley
  • Chenlin Song
  • Karlene A. Cimprich
Article 21 Dec 2022

elements.title: Actin cytoskeleton and complex cell architecture in an Asgard archaeon (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Actin cytoskeleton and complex cell architecture in an Asgard archaeon

Culture and analysis of ‘Candidatus Lokiarchaeum ossiferum’—a member of the Asgard phylum—reveals an elaborate cell architecture with extensive membranous protrusions.

  • Thiago Rodrigues-Oliveira
  • Florian Wollweber
  • Christa Schleper
Article Open Access 21 Dec 2022

elements.title: Topological lattices realized in superconducting circuit optomechanics (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Topological lattices realized in superconducting circuit optomechanics

Optomechanical lattices in one and two dimensions with exceptionally low disorder are realized, showing how the optomechanical interaction can be exploited for direct measurements of the Hamiltonian, beyond the tight-binding approximation.

  • Amir Youssefi
  • Shingo Kono
  • Tobias J. Kippenberg
Article 21 Dec 2022

elements.title: A cortico-collicular circuit for orienting to shelter during escape (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A cortico-collicular circuit for orienting to shelter during escape

The retrosplenial cortex and superior colliculus of mouse form a neural circuit that specifically encodes shelter location, facilitating rapid escape from predatory threats.

  • Dario Campagner
  • Ruben Vale
  • Tiago Branco
Article 21 Dec 2022

elements.title: Inheritance of paternal DNA damage by histone-mediated repair restriction (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Inheritance of paternal DNA damage by histone-mediated repair restriction

In Caenorhabditis elegans, paternal exposure to ionizing radiation results in HIS-24 and HPL-1-dependent genome instability phenotypes, causing embryonic lethality in the offspring.

  • Siyao Wang
  • David H. Meyer
  • Björn Schumacher
Article Open Access 21 Dec 2022

elements.title: BRD8 maintains glioblastoma by epigenetic reprogramming of the p53 network (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
BRD8 maintains glioblastoma by epigenetic reprogramming of the p53 network

BRD8 is identified as a specific epigenetic vulnerability for glioblastomas that harbour wild-type p53.

  • Xueqin Sun
  • Olaf Klingbeil
  • Alea A. Mills
Article 21 Dec 2022

elements.title: Vela pulsar wind nebula X-rays are polarized to near the synchrotron limit (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Vela pulsar wind nebula X-rays are polarized to near the synchrotron limit

Polarization can exceed 60% at the leading edge of the inner part of the Vela pulsar wind nebula; in contrast with the case of the supernova remnant, the electrons in the pulsar wind nebula are accelerated with little or no turbulence in a highly uniform magnetic field.

  • Fei Xie
  • Alessandro Di Marco
  • Silvia Zane
Article 21 Dec 2022

elements.title: Senescence atlas reveals an aged-like inflamed niche that blunts muscle regeneration (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Senescence atlas reveals an aged-like inflamed niche that blunts muscle regeneration

A lifetime cartography of in vivo senescent cells shows that they are heterogeneous. Senescent cells create an aged-like inflamed niche that mirrors inflammation associated with ageing and arrests stem cell proliferation and tissue regeneration.

  • Victoria Moiseeva
  • Andrés Cisneros
  • Pura Muñoz-Cánoves
Article Open Access 21 Dec 2022

elements.title: The molecular evolution of spermatogenesis across mammals (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
The molecular evolution of spermatogenesis across mammals

Evolutionary analyses of single-nucleus transcriptome data for testes from 11 species are reported, illuminating the molecular evolution of spermatogenesis and associated forces, and providing a resource for investigating the testis across mammals.

  • Florent Murat
  • Noe Mbengue
  • Henrik Kaessmann
Article Open Access 21 Dec 2022

elements.title: Synthesis-on-substrate of quantum dot solids (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Synthesis-on-substrate of quantum dot solids

Ultrasmall monodisperse perovskite quantum dots are synthesized in situ on a substrate via ligand structure regulation, yielding the highest external quantum efficiency blue perovskite LEDs reported so far.

  • Yuanzhi Jiang
  • Changjiu Sun
  • Mingjian Yuan
Article 21 Dec 2022

elements.title: Locus coeruleus activity improves cochlear implant performance (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Locus coeruleus activity improves cochlear implant performance

Behavioural studies with deafened rats show that locus coeruleus activity and plasticity are key to rapid adaptation to and long-term hearing performance with cochlear implants.

  • Erin Glennon
  • Silvana Valtcheva
  • Robert C. Froemke
Article 21 Dec 2022

elements.title: Imprinted SARS-CoV-2 humoral immunity induces convergent Omicron RBD evolution (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Imprinted SARS-CoV-2 humoral immunity induces convergent Omicron RBD evolution

  • Yunlong Cao
  • Fanchong Jian
  • Xiaoliang Sunney Xie
Article 19 Dec 2022

elements.title: Ovarian cancer mutational processes drive site-specific immune evasion (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
Ovarian cancer mutational processes drive site-specific immune evasion

Multi-modal analysis of genomically unstable ovarian tumours characterizes the contribution of anatomical sites and mutational processes to evolutionary phenotypic divergence and immune resistance mechanisms.

  • Ignacio Vázquez-García
  • Florian Uhlitz
  • Sohrab P. Shah
Article Open Access 14 Dec 2022

elements.title: A male germ-cell-specific ribosome controls male fertility (Nature - research articles)
elements.contents:
A male germ-cell-specific ribosome controls male fertility

RibosomeST—a ribosome with a specialized nascent polypeptide exit tunnel—cotranslationally regulates the folding of a subset of male germ-cell-specific proteins that are essential for the formation of sperm.

  • Huiling Li
  • Yangao Huo
  • Jiahao Sha
Article 14 Dec 2022
